page.title: 04COTTAGE FARM.
page.content: {Cottage Farm}was built in 1837, although a farm has stood on the same site since before the{Domesday {Book.}In the winter from November till April the cattle are brought inside and are fed from the farmer.The mothers and their young are brought into separate sheds where there is more shelter and it is warmer. Years ago when people used horses and carts the horses were kept in sheds near the cattle.The horses had separate stables from each other and had plenty of food through the winter. {Mains water}and{electricty}were only introduced in the{late 40's. Before electricity, people used paraffin lamps.The farmer would hang these on hooks in the middle of the room. Water was obtained from one of four wells.{Filtered drinking water could be brought from Crowle,in carts.
